sen.j: 朗詠江注（ろうえいごうちゅう）は、大江匡房によって著された和漢朗詠集の注釈書である。
sen.e: Roei Gochu, written by OE no Masafusa, is a commentary on the Wakan roei shu (Japanese and Chinese poems to sing).
Roei Gochu, written by OE no Masafusa, is a commentary on the Wakan Roei Shu (Japanese and Chinese singing poems).
sen.cmt: capitalized "Roei Shu"; "poems to sing" is awkward, changed it to "singing poems"
sen.e: Roei Gochu, written by OE no Masafusa, is a commentary on the Wakan Roei Shu (Japanese and Chinese singing poems).
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 成立は不明であるが、大江匡房没年の天永2年（1111年）が成立の下限と考えられる。
sen.e: Although the period in which it was written is unknown, it is thought to have been written no later than 1111, when OE no Masafusa passed away.
Although the period in which it was written is unknown, it is thought to have been written no later than 1111 when OE no Masafusa passed away.
sen.cmt: eliminated comma as it felt unecessary
sen.e: Although the period in which it was written is unknown, it is thought to have been written no later than 1111 when OE no Masafusa passed away.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 袋草子などに朗詠江注からの引用がみられることから、従来より逸書と考えられていた。
sen.e: It was thought to have been lost because quotations from the Roei Gochu are seen in some works such as the Fukurozoshi (Notes in a Folder, the collection of poetic lore).
The commentary was believed to have been lost, indicated by quotations from the Roei Gochu being seen in other works such as the Fukurozoshi (Notes in a Folder, the collection of poetice lore).
sen.cmt: fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: The commentary was believed to have been lost, indicated by quotations from the Roei Gochu being seen in other works such as the Fukurozoshi (Notes in a Folder, the collection of poetic lore).
sen.cmt: スペルを修正しました。

sen.j: 朗詠江注は逸書なのか、という点については、堀部正二や太田次郎らにより疑義が提出されている。
sen.e: Scholars such as Shoji HORIBE and Jiro OTA expressed doubts about whether the Roei Gochu had survived.
Scholars such as Shoji HORIBE and Jiro OTA expressed doubts as to whether or not the Roei Gochu had been lost.
sen.cmt: fixed grammar
sen.e: Scholars such as Shoji HORIBE and Jiro OTA expressed doubts as to whether or not the Roei Gochu had been lost.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: それによれば、朗詠江注は、和漢朗詠集本文の行間の書き入れや裏書に書き入れられていた簡単な注記類であり、書物として成立していたのではないというものである。
sen.e: According to them, the Roei Gochu was written not as a book but as brief glosses written in the spaces between lines or on the back of the text of the Wakan roei shu.
According to their evidence, the Roei Gochu was written not as a book, but as a brief glossary written between the spaces or lines on the back of the text of the Waka Roei Shu.
sen.cmt: According to them→According to their evidence; "glosses" may be appropriate but it sounds awkward to me, so I changed it to "glossary"; capitalized "Waka Roei Shu"
sen.e: According to their evidence, the Roei Gochu was written not as a book, but as a brief glossary written between the spaces or lines or on the back of the text of the Waka Roei Shu.
sen.cmt: 一部翻訳を修正しました。

sen.j: 現在、我々が「朗詠江注」として触れ得るものは、和漢朗詠集本文の余白への書き入れや裏書などによってである。
sen.e: What we read as the 'Roei Gochu' today is what was written in the margins or on the back of the text of the Wakan roei shu.
What is read today as the "Roei Gochu" is what was written inside the margins and on the back of the text of the Wakan Roei Shu.
sen.cmt: fixed grammar to read more naturally; capitalized "Roei Shu"
sen.e: What is read today as the 'Roei Gochu' is what was written inside the margins and on the back of the text of the Wakan Roei Shu.
sen.cmt: "→ ' としました。

sen.j: このことから、朗詠江注は、和漢朗詠集本文への書き入れなどが主であり、一書ではなかったと考えるべきであろう。
sen.e: From this reason, one should probably conclude that the Roei Gochu was not written as a book but was composed of mainly notes written into the text of the Wakan roei shu.
For this reason, it should probably be concluded that the Roei Gochu was not written as book, but composed of mainly notes written into the text of the Wakan Roei Shu.
sen.cmt: fixed grammar to read more naturally; capitalized "Roei Shu"
sen.e: For this reason, it should probably be concluded that the Roei Gochu was not written as book, but composed of mainly notes written into the text of the Wakan Roei Shu.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 朗詠江注は、江談抄との関連が指摘されている。
sen.e: It has been pointed out that the Roei Gochu has some connection with the Godansho (the Oe Conversations, with anecdotes and gossip).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It has been indicated that the Roei Gochu shares some connection with the Godansho (The Oe Conversations, with anecdotes and gossip).
sen.cmt: fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: It has been indicated that the Roei Gochu shares some connection with the Godansho (The Oe Conversations, with anecdotes and gossip).
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: また後の和漢朗詠集私注などの和漢朗詠集の注釈書にも影響を与えている。
sen.e: It also affected the later commentaries on the Wakan roei shu such as the Wakan roei shu Shichu (Personal glosses on the Wakan roei shu).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The Roei Gochu also influenced later commentaries on the Wakan Roei Shu, such as the Wakan Roei Shu Shichu (Personal glossary on the Wakan Roei Shu).
sen.cmt: It→The Roei Gochu; affected→influenced; capitalized names of collections; glosses→glossary
sen.e: The Roei Gochu also influenced later commentaries on the Wakan Roei Shu, such as the Wakan Roei Shu Shichu (Personal glossary on the Wakan Roei Shu).
sen.cmt: 修正なし
